pages.text: Applied Energistics 2 is a storage mod.$(br2)In Cottage Witch, we have $(l)heavily$() modified the recipes and gameplay surrounding AE2 to make it more thematic and accessible for all skill levels.

pages.title: Storing Items
pages.text: AE2 has a different method of storing items compared to Refined Storage. In RS, you would want to make a Celestial Glyphstone (or 64k drive) to store as many items as possible.$(br2)With AE2, there is a limit to the number of unique items you can put into each glyphstone.

pages.title: Storing Items
pages.text: Take a look at the Celestial Glyphstone in AE2 by hovering over it here. It says there are 0 of $(l)63 types$().$(br2)This means that $(l)63 unique items$() can go into that glyphstone.

There is another number there - 0 of 65536 Facets. This is the $(l)total number$() of items that can go into this glyphstone.$(br2)This means you can stack a $(l)large amount$() of any of the $(o)63 unique item types$().$(br2)However, as soon as you try to put a 64th item type in, you won't be able to.

pages.title: Which Glyphstone to Use
pages.text: Crafting the Gems (comparable to crafting glyphs in RS) is more complex due to how their storage works.

We recommend starting with the $(l)Arcane Resonant Glyphstones (4k)$() for storing most your items while getting the most out of your resources.$(br2)If you find you have a large amount of some items, consider storing them in a $(l)functional storage drawer$() or making the larger glyphstones!

pages.title: Making an AE2 system
pages.text: Picture of a simple AE2 Setup

We couldn't get a multiblock for this setup in, so please take an image in its stead.$(br2)For a simple setup, you will need a Glyphic Repository, Lodestone Core, and a Nexus Crafting Aperture/Scrying Nexus on a cable!$(br2)The Crafting Aperture allows viewing $(l)and crafting.

pages.title: External Storage
pages.text: Want to hookup your Functional Storage Drawers?$(br2)You can replace your Refined Storage $(thing)External Storage$() with the $(item)Nexus Storage Anchor$()!$(br2)Remember that the $(item)Storage Anchor$() requires a cable connected to your AE2 system.
You can connect this to your Functional Storage $(thing)Storage Controller!

pages.title: Going Wireless
pages.text: Your wireless journey will require a handful of items and blocks.$(br2)To start, add these two blocks onto your existing AE2 system: The $(thing)Resonance Access Point$() and the $(thing)Guardian Ward$(). $(br2)Then you will need to connect your $(item)Resonant Aperture$().

pages.title: Getting Access
pages.text: Connect to your network by shift clicking your $(item)Resonant Aperture$() inside your $(thing)Guardian Ward$().$(br2)After removing it you will have short range wireless access!
Example of Guardian Ward with linked Resonant Aperture!

Next, let's get the required materials for $(l)cross-dimensional$() access.$(br2)We will need to make a $(thing)Planar Relay$(), which is made using the fairy ring on the right!$(br2)Inside the fairy ring, toss an $(item)Eye of Ender$(), $(item)Rough Lazurite$(), $(item)Tablet of Binding$(), and $(thing)Consecrated Certus Quartz Crystal$()

pages.name: Fairy Ring
pages.text: The center dirt blocks can be any block

With the $(thing)Planar Relay$(), you will make two $(l)linked$() $(thing)Entangled Planar Relays.$()$(br2)In order to do this, you will need to explode a $(thing)Planar Relay$() and $(thing)Ender Dust$() or an Ender Pearl.$(br2)You can obtain $(thing)Ender Dust$() by crushing an ender pearl using a crushing wheel or a millstone.
For a small explosion that causes no block damage use $(thing)Tiny TNT$()!$(br2)Drop both items on the ground next to the Tiny TNT and then light it with a flint and steel.

pages.title: Crossing Dimensions
pages.text: A multiblock structure will need to be connected to your AE2 system.$(br2)After connecting the $(item)Planar Relay Link$() with a cable, right click on the center block and insert one $(thing)Entangled Planar Relay$().
Finally, we will need a $(thing)Planar Bridge Card$() and the second $(thing)Entangled Planar Relay$().$(br2)Open your $(thing)Resonant Aperture$() and find the sidebar to the right
$(l)Manually$() insert both items into the sidebar.
